intro: Cerastium unalaschkense, commonly known as the Alaskan mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the Arctic and subarctic regions of North America and Eurasia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically opposite, rounded, and covered in fine hairs, adapted to withstand cold and harsh environmental conditions. Cerastium unalaschkense thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in tundra and alpine habitats.
